item.title: Metals Slip as Risk Sentiment Wanes
item.description: Base metals and gold prices were falling in early London trading as a limited growth outlook globally is expected to cap demand.

item.title: Oil Slips After Saudi Arabia's Price Cuts
item.description: Oil prices were around 1% lower after Saudi Arabia slashed the price for its flagship Arab Light crude to Asian customers.

item.title: Dollar Could Fall as Markets Still Believe Fed Might Cut Rates in March
item.description: The dollar was steady, failing to benefit much from the stronger-than-expected U.S. jobs data, and looks at risk of falling as investors “remain confident” the Fed might cut interest rates in March, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Eurozone Gross Bond Supply in 2024 Seen in Line With 2023; Net Supply is Heavy
item.description: Gross government bond supply by the eurozone’s largest 11 sovereign issuers is expected at €1.218 trillion in 2024, just €29 billion lower than that in 2023, Citi Research said.

item.title: Pandora Boosted by Strong Fourth-Quarter Sales
item.description: Pandora said organic growth for the year was ahead of guidance after a robust fourth-quarter that included a 9% rise in like-for-like sales.

item.title: Germany Factory Orders Rise Slightly
item.description: German manufacturing orders recovered a little in November, although the 0.3% rise was much lower than forecast by economists.

item.title: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin remained in the hospital after he underwent an undisclosed elective procedure in late December and dropped from view within the department.
item.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin remained in the hospital after he underwent an undisclosed elective procedure in late December and dropped from view within the department.

item.title: Congressional leaders reached a bipartisan deal setting a roughly $1.6 trillion federal spending level for the year, but it remained unclear whether lawmakers would be able to quickly pass legislation averting a government shutdown.
item.description: Congressional leaders reached a bipartisan deal setting a roughly $1.6 trillion federal spending level for the year, but it remained unclear whether lawmakers would be able to quickly pass legislation averting a government shutdown.

item.title: Homicides in big U.S. cities fell in 2023 after skyrocketing during the first two years of the pandemic.
item.description: Homicides in big U.S. cities fell in 2023 after skyrocketing during the first two years of the pandemic.

item.title: Israel and Egypt are negotiating the future of a corridor between Egypt and Gaza that Israel says has been used by Hamas to smuggle weapons and people through underground tunnels and is key to destroying the militant group.
item.description: Israel and Egypt are negotiating the future of a corridor between Egypt and Gaza that Israel says has been used by Hamas to smuggle weapons and people through underground tunnels and is key to destroying the militant group.

item.title: Travelers faced heavy flight cancellations by United and Alaska airlines, one of the ripple effects from the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX 9.
item.description: Travelers faced heavy flight cancellations by United and Alaska airlines, one of the ripple effects from the grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX 9.

item.title: A group of bipartisan senators hopes to release its proposal to tighten U.S. border laws later this week, a top negotiator said, with any deal likely to face an uphill battle in Congress.
item.description: A group of bipartisan senators hopes to release its proposal to tighten U.S. border laws later this week, a top negotiator said, with any deal likely to face an uphill battle in Congress.

item.title: A federal probe into Friday's abortive Alaska Airlines flight has started with a narrow focus on the door plug that violently blew off the aircraft in midair, leaving a gaping hole in the side of the plane's fuselage.
item.description: A federal probe into Friday’s abortive Alaska Airlines flight has started with a narrow focus on the door plug that violently blew off the aircraft in midair, leaving a gaping hole in the side of the plane’s fuselage.

item.title: For early 2024, investors are looking to the coming earnings season for clarity on companies' growth prospects.
item.description: For early 2024, investors are looking to the coming earnings season for clarity on companies’ growth prospects.

item.title: A former stay-at-home mom is shaking up the instant-ramen industry with Samyang Roundsquare's highly spiced Buldak noodles, now being distributed in U.S. supermarkets.
item.description: A former stay-at-home mom is shaking up the instant-ramen industry with Samyang Roundsquare’s highly spiced Buldak noodles, now being distributed in U.S. supermarkets.

item.title: A likely peak in interest rates for this economic cycle should make further investments in Treasurys and highly rated corporate bonds a good bet, analysts and portfolio managers said.
item.description: A likely peak in interest rates for this economic cycle should make further investments in Treasurys and highly rated corporate bonds a good bet, analysts and portfolio managers said.

item.title: Mutual-fund investors rode last year's rebound in large tech stocks, as more than 1,000 of the 1,191 funds tracked in a Wall Street Journal survey posted double-digit gains for 2023.
item.description: Mutual-fund investors rode last year’s rebound in large tech stocks, as more than 1,000 of the 1,191 funds tracked in a Wall Street Journal survey posted double-digit gains for 2023.

item.title: Video creator Jimmy Donaldson, known to his viewers as MrBeast, has so far resisted Musk's overtures to bring him to X, saying the economics don't work.
item.description: Video creator Jimmy Donaldson, known to his viewers as MrBeast, has so far resisted Musk’s overtures to bring him to X, saying the economics don’t work.

item.title: Skeptics say the bitcoin rally provoked by the expected launch of the first U.S. exchange-traded funds to hold the cryptocurrency is nearly out of room to run.
item.description: Skeptics say the bitcoin rally provoked by the expected launch of the first U.S. exchange-traded funds to hold the cryptocurrency is nearly out of room to run.

item.title: Chinese buyers are pushing back against lower-powered artificial-intelligence chips that Nvidia hopes to sell them in response to U.S. export restrictions.
item.description: Chinese buyers are pushing back against lower-powered artificial-intelligence chips that Nvidia hopes to sell them in response to U.S. export restrictions.
